Description: Register 1988 A broad sleeved dress of machine spun, black silk damask cloth with flower motifs, lined with orange cotton cloth around the neck and shouldeers, and embroidered on the front with multicoloured stitchwork. Numerous mother-of-pearl and white plastic buttons and various plastic charms in different colours have also been stitched to the front of the dress.
Curator's comments: Described by the vendor as a wedding dress.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995, London, Museum of Mankind (Room 5), 'Display and Modesty'
Acquisition notes: Af1988,07.1 and 2 are a weddiong dress and a shawl, both made and purchased in Siwa, Egypt, in 1988; they were purchased from Mr Adrian Richardson.
